授業目的: Students will work on extending their fluency of expression through activities centered around a topics-based syllabus. Critical thinking with a cross-cultural perspective will be fostered on a range of topical issues to do with lifestyles, customs and behavior, with the intention of raising student awareness of aspects of their own culture and similarities or differences in other cultures. Vocabulary work will seek to broaden understanding of collocation patterns and familiarity with idiomatic language. [This class uses the same textbook as 英語ＢI and II but covers the latter half of the book.]
到達目標: Students will be trained to express their opinions in short speeches. Writing practice will include personal and business letter writing, journal writing, and the process involved in writing outlines, drafting, editing and revising essays.
授業方法: This course will be held in-person on campus unless emergency events related to the pandemic force a change of format. General features: Grammar practice, student-centered speaking practice monitored by the instructor, pair work, group work, creative writing and conversation practice, oral and written feedback on assignments.
